title: 106_hr204
content: The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new credit for high technology job training expenses under Subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The high technology job training credit is 50% of qualified expenses for training full-time employees in information technology, with a maximum credit of $2,500 per employee. The term 'information technology occupation' refers to roles involving computer-based information systems. A 'substantially full-time employee' works at least 30 hours per week. Aggregation rules apply to certain employer classifications. The section discusses the treatment of expenses for certain job training credits and the termination of the application of the section after December 31, 2003. Additionally, it amends the calculation of the current year business credit and disallows deductions for certain job training expenses. The section amends the treatment of job training expenses and disallows deductions for certain expenses. It also adjusts the calculation of the current year business credit. The section amends job training expenses treatment, disallows deductions for certain expenses, and adjusts the calculation of the current year business credit. It includes limitations on carryback of high technology job training credit and a clerical amendment to the tax code. The amendments made by this section regarding the credit for high technology job training will apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
